job_tasks.phrase: push us to the next architectural design of our credit risk program. This means thinking about, trying out and applying this new architecture.
job_tasks.justification: This phrase describes the core software engineering task of designing and implementing new architectural solutions for an existing program.

job_tasks.phrase: Build and maintain new ETL solutions and calculation engines.
job_tasks.justification: Building and maintaining ETL solutions and calculation engines are traditional software development tasks focused on data processing and integration.

job_tasks.phrase: Implement a new architecture to deliver data to the Credit Risk Datawarehouse applications.
job_tasks.justification: This directly refers to the integration of systems and the implementation of architectural designs, a core software engineering responsibility.

job_tasks.phrase: Improving stability, performance, and reliability of the Credit Risk applications.
job_tasks.justification: Enhancing the non-functional aspects of existing software applications is a fundamental software engineering task.

job_tasks.phrase: Whatever software you develop, you own it and support it in the full lifecycle of your product.
job_tasks.justification: This describes product ownership and full lifecycle support for developed software, a key aspect of software engineering roles.

job_tasks.phrase: your software requires to be trustworthy and you are keen to be the best in class to learn and apply security standards.
job_tasks.justification: Focusing on software trustworthiness and applying security standards falls under the umbrella of robust software development practices.

job_tasks.phrase: Build scalable deployment pipelines, to support Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery.
job_tasks.justification: Building CI/CD pipelines is a core MLOps/DevOps task, essential for software deployment and maintenance.

job_tasks.phrase: Automate test and make it part of the design, code, build and release process.
job_tasks.justification: Automating testing within the software development lifecycle is a key aspect of CI/CD and MLOps.

job_tasks.phrase: Own your product and know how your product(s) are performing implementing the required Observability/Monitoring.
job_tasks.justification: Implementing observability and monitoring for product performance is a crucial MLOps/DevOps responsibility.

job_tasks.phrase: Optimization of the service stability and continuity.
job_tasks.justification: This task focuses on improving the operational stability and continuity of services, which is a software engineering concern.

job_tasks.phrase: Enhance the CI/CD maturity, move to a containerized environment, prepare for the move to the public cloud etc.
job_tasks.justification: These are all infrastructure and deployment related tasks that fall under software engineering and MLOps practices.

job_tasks.phrase: The focus is on high-quality secure-critical software delivered in time.
job_tasks.justification: This statement emphasizes the delivery of high-quality, secure software, a fundamental goal of software engineering.

soft_skills.justification: Explicitly states the need for communicative skills, which falls under communication and collaboration.

soft_skills.phrase: We expect you to share and teach your knowledge to other team members as well.
soft_skills.justification: This highlights the importance of knowledge sharing and teaching, which are key aspects of collaboration.

soft_skills.phrase: push us to the next architectural design of our credit risk program.
soft_skills.justification: This implies understanding the business context (credit risk) and strategizing for architectural improvements.

soft_skills.phrase: deliver best in class data, insights and advice which empower our consumers to control, explain, predict and optimise the performance of ING.
soft_skills.justification: This describes the business vision and purpose, requiring an understanding of how technology serves business goals.

soft_skills.phrase: Help Credit Risk to make big steps to the future.
soft_skills.justification: This indicates a strategic role in advancing the business unit's capabilities.

soft_skills.phrase: have a vision on how to provide our services in the future.
soft_skills.justification: This requires strategic thinking and understanding of future service delivery within the business context.

soft_skills.phrase: Whatever software you develop, you own it and support it in the full lifecycle of your product.
soft_skills.justification: This emphasizes product ownership and responsibility, aligning with innovation and ownership.

soft_skills.phrase: Own your product and know how your product(s) are performing implementing the required Observability/Monitoring.
soft_skills.justification: This reinforces the concept of owning the product and its performance, which is a key aspect of ownership.

soft_skills.phrase: keen to be the best in class to learn and apply security standards.
soft_skills.justification: This shows a desire to learn and apply new standards, indicating adaptability and a growth mindset.

soft_skills.phrase: Enhance the CI/CD maturity, move to a containerized environment, prepare for the move to the public cloud etc.
soft_skills.justification: These tasks involve adopting new technologies and methodologies (containerization, cloud migration), requiring learning and adaptability.

profile.rationale: The job advertisement focuses heavily on traditional software engineering tasks such as building and maintaining ETL solutions, implementing new architectures, improving application stability, and managing the full software lifecycle. It also includes MLOps/DevOps responsibilities like CI/CD pipelines and monitoring. There is no mention of Generative AI, LLMs, prompt engineering, or RAG. The technologies listed (Java, Oracle, Kafka) are standard software development tools, not specific AI/ML frameworks. Therefore, the role is classified as a Software Engineer.

confidence.reasoning: The job ad is very clear and specific about the responsibilities and technologies involved. It explicitly focuses on traditional software engineering and data processing within a credit risk context, with no indication of Generative AI or advanced ML specialization. The tasks and technologies align perfectly with the definition of a Software Engineer profile.
